definitions.text:
fane. [Latin fingo. The Latin forms fictum, fictus, whence figura, figure, also fucus.]
1. To invent or imagine; to form an idea or conception of something not real. There are no such things done as thou sayest, but thou feignest them out of thine own heart. Nehemiah 6:8.
2. To make a show of; to pretend; to assume a false appearance; to counterfeit. pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner. 2 Samuel 14:2. She feigns a laugh.
3. To represent falsely; to pretend; to form and relate a fictitious tale. The poet did feign that Orpheus drew trees, stones, and floods.
4. To dissemble; to conceal. obsolete
